title: Why do people complain when a Bruiser can kill a squishy?
body:
I find it so odd when people complain "WOW, this champion only built 1-2 damage items, how can he _possibly_ be killing my squishies?"

I mean I get the logic that if you compare 1-2 damage items vs 5-6 damage items, clearly one is going to do more than the other. But consider that the squishy champions we're comparing here often are running around with _0_ real defensive items. I mean, I'm pretty sure I remember from elementary school that 1 or 2 is certainly greater than 0. It really shouldn't be that odd then, that a champion that does maybe _just_ on-par damage still succeeds at being a threat towards someone with _weeeeell_ below average defense.

They don't seem to understand that defensive stats are combat stats.

An item can make you stronger without increasing the raw damage you deal.
People more so complain becasue 1 to 2 damage items on a bruiser is a lot more efficient than 1 to 2 defensive items on a squishy.

Because most squishies have the advantage of range over bruisers. Ergo defensive items aren't the best on them because those are built to reduce damage taken. A squishy wants to avoid taking damage in general. 

There's a reason melee champions have scaling MR.

Range isn't that big of an advantage over bruisers. Most of them have either MS boost or a gap closer to get around that. You're basically telling people they should build defense on squishys but it shouldn't be as effective anyway. Then whats the point of building defense on a squishy.

There isn't much of a point to build defense on a squishy. Lifesteal is their best defensive option outside of burst shields and that's a defense gained through offense. 

Squishy champions already have lower base defensive stats than others. They shouldn't be getting equal benefits of defense from defensive items. The same is true for offense items on bruisers. They don't deal the same level of damage that a full damage squishy does. 

The thing is, they don't need to deal squishy level damage to kill a squishy because they are _squishy_. 

What do you think is the trade off for building mainly damage?

That's the heart of the issue. Bruisers don't pay as much on offense for a mainly defensive build as squishy do for it. I mean you say they don't do as much damage. I mean what is the trade off for building mainly tanky if its not a loss of offense?

{{item:3124}} - Offense

MAW was so bad people would tell you to build BV on a squishy for MR. This is the effect of "bruiser itemization." As an aside, your line reminds me of Ezreal, another naturally squishy champion who itemizes some defense into his build.

No I'm not. Its never been possible to abuse brusier items on squishys until these items were reworked or introduced. Thats the problem, bruiser items keep become more and more efficient to the point where even squishys are building them.

One becasue its about AP champs, and AP itemization isn't currently the issue. And two because your list of AD is mostly filled with actual bruisers that were never abusing items.

Bruiser meta's are never good for the game. Either through actual champs being strong or cases where their itemization is out of hand.

Sarcasm is stronk.

And isn't your ADC comment literally a statement to discredit yourself as is?

How is my ADC comment discrediting my self? I said that squishys didn't make use of bruiser items, because in the past they didn't. You had to go back to what pre season 3 and the league of cleavers to find something even similar to what we have now. Then you start listing a bunch of champion who aren't supposed to be building squishy and say that they all abuse bruiser items. At least 2/3 of the AD's you listed were designed to build like a bruiser. 

It wasn't until Riot introduced bruiser items and over tuned them that it was possible for actual squishys who should be building damage to be considered bruisers. You really think MAW and Steraks was made for ADC's? No, the reason everyone hates bruisers is because if they themselves aren't broken, like Xin, Jax, Udyr, and Mundo to name a few this year, then their itemization is ruining game balance.

>How is my ADC comment discrediting my self?

Because:
- Most Bot Lane Marksman (ADCs) don't build bruiser. Top and Jungle Marksmen do (non-ADCs, like Quinn, who was a Marksman of in the past that certainly took advantage of light defense in her offensive kit), but unless you're named Ezreal, the Marksman in actually carry roles are closer to glass cannons.
- The few Bot Lane Marksman that do build defense only build 1-2 defense items at most, which contradicts your "People more so complain becasue 1 to 2 damage items on a bruiser is a lot more efficient than 1 to 2 defensive items on a squishy."

And you're totally right, I did have to dig that far, for two big reasons. First of all, the Cleaver meta was _infinitely worse_ than what we see today. Second of all, Balance, on average, is only improving. Edge cases are edge cases yes but we don't have one item literally defining the meta as badly as Cleaver or Warmog's Armor or so on did back in their days (Speaking of, Fratmog's Meta. Another Bruiser meta).

Aatrox is a melee carry. Evelynn is an Assassin. Ezreal is a Marksman. Fizz is an Assassin. (old) Fiora was a melee carry. (old) GP was a Melee Carry. Irelia is a melee carry. Kayle is a hybrid carry in every sense of the phrase. Kennen is an AP Carry. Kha'Zix is an Assassin. Yi is the definition of a melee carry. Nocturne is a melee carry. Quinn is a Marksman. Rengar is an Assassin. Riven is a melee carry. Udyr...well he's Udyr. Xin is a melee carry. Yasuo is a melee carry.

I count 18 champs of my 31 champ list that are intrinsically damage based. This ignores that Dive Fighters {{champion:59}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:254}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:62}} literally straddle the lines of an assassin and an engage tank. This ignores my statement of primarily offensive champions that require defense {{champion:39}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:83}}. At best, Rek'Sai, Trundle, and Shyvana are legitimate bruisers through and through with their given definition. Every other champion however is based in offense or only uses defense out of necessity. 

Finally, if you think Xin, Jax, Udyr, and Mundo are a problem _now_, where were you during S4?

For me it's because as a squishy I usually have to auto them many many times to kill them whereas they all seem to have some quick and easy to use gap closer and some kind of stun or snare to go with it and on top of that they still kill me in 2 hits.  In my opinion bruisers don't pay enough of a price to get as much damage as they do while still being somewhat hard to kill - not as bad as a full tank mind you but enough that if they are ever moving toward me I have to either find some way to kite/CC or flash or I'm just dead.

>if they are ever moving toward me I have to either find some way to kite/CC or flash or I'm just dead.

...That's how Marksmen are supposed to handle their problems in the first place.

The point I was making is that it's too easy now for bruisers to output damage quickly in bursts where they can kill squishies easily, yet squishies can't kill them easily in return.  It doesn't matter how much damage you can do it matters at how effective you are at outputting your damage.  Yes marksman are supposed to kite obviously but you can't kite everything or predict every flash and anytime you get near a fight someone is always in range to close the distance and now they simply delete you instantly.

I think marksman with dashes or blinks or whatever term you want to do are actually okay, but the less mobile ones in my opinion are too easy to lockdown and kill and it's too hard to output their damage.  I mean think back to previous seasons.  Renekton was always a lane bully and a strong early/mid game champ but did typically fall off late game.  Now with the itemization changes he can build 2 damage items, then go either tank or hybrid items and he is a lethal threat still late game to any squishy whereas in previous season he wasn't really a lethal threat on his own at least it took him sometime to kill you.  Now you die immediately during his stun or you are chunked so incredibly low you are effectively out of the fight.
